author: Reuters Editorial
title: Barnes & Noble Education Reports Q3 Loss Per Share $6.04
text:
March 1 (Reuters) - Barnes & Noble Education Inc:
* BARNES & NOBLE EDUCATION REPORTS THIRD QUARTER 2018 FINANCIAL RESULTS
* Q3 SALES ROSE 15.7 PERCENT TO $603.4 MILLION * FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018, COMPANY CONTINUES TO EXPECT SALES AT BNC TO BE RELATIVELY FLAT
* CONTINUED TO RECOGNIZE BENEFITS OF SYNERGIES AND INTEGRATION OF MBS, WITH $138.9 MILLION OF SALES IN Q3
* BARNES & NOBLE EDUCATION - FOR 2018, BNC COMPARABLE STORE SALES ARE PROJECTED TO DECLINE IN MID-SINGLE DIGIT PERCENTAGE POINT RANGE YEAR OVER YEAR
* CONTINUES TO EXPECT 2018 CONSOLIDATED SALES TO BE IN RANGE OF $2.25 BILLION TO $2.35 BILLION BEFORE INTERCOMPANY ELIMINATIONS
* COMPARABLE STORE SALES AT BNC DECREASED 6.2% FOR QUARTER * BARNES & NOBLE EDUCATION - RAISING CONSOLIDATED ADJUSTED EBITDA GUIDANCE, EXPECTS TO ACHIEVE CONSOLIDATED ADJUSTED EBITDA OF $115 MILLION TO $125 MILLION FOR 2018
* SEES 2018 CAPITAL EXPENDITURES TO BE APPROXIMATELY $45 MILLION
* QTRLY NET LOSS INCLUDES PRE-TAX GOODWILL NON-CASH IMPAIRMENT CHARGE OF $313.1 MILLION AT BNC Source text for Eikon: (Reuters.Brief@thomsonreuters.com)
